definition: to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit

sentences.english: The falsification of the testament [will] was discovered by them.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现这份遗嘱被窜改了。

sentences.english: The book-keeper manipulated the company's accounts to conceal his theft.
sentences.chinese: 那会计窜改公司帐目以掩饰他的盗窃行为。

sentences.english: Volatility is the measure of change in the price of electricity over a given period of time.
sentences.chinese: 仄稳率是衡终婺窜改正在电价正在给定的韶光周期内。

sentences.english: Sunshine changes colour as it goes through the drops of water in the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 当阳光脱过云中的水滴是窜改了色彩。
那个出纳员窜改了账目。

sentences.english: The mutability of the past is the central tenet of Ingsoc.
sentences.chinese: 窜改过去是英社的中心原则。

sentences.english: A child can easily adjust to changes in the environment.
sentences.chinese: 孩子很沉易适应环境的窜改。

sentences.english: He changed his style of painting when he returned from Paris.
sentences.chinese: 他从巴黎回去后便窜改了绘风。

sentences.english: The past never had been altered.

definition: to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
variant of 抹殺|抹杀[mo3 sha1]
to cite/to quote/to cite as evidence
